intro: Crambe hispanica subsp. hispanica, commonly known as Spanish crambe, is an annual herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and alternate, pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in the summer months. Its seeds are enclosed in hairy, triangular pods, and the plant is often found in dry, calcareous soils. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
